title: debug/goobj: decide whether it goes into Go 1.3
body:
New package debug/goobj supports the new cmd/nm and eventually the new cmd/ld. But
should it be in the standard tree? The argument in favor is that debug/elf, debug/macho,
debug/pe are all there, and it keeps the prereq for these commands in the tree. The
argument against is that I probably wouldn't put any of them in the standard library if
I were doing it again today.

Perhaps debug/goobj can be put somewhere else in the main repo that is not the standard
tree, or maybe it should be in a subrepo, or it is fine where it is. Decide.
